Author: riddler18k#0791
Content: hey guys, if you have multiple assets, how do they talk to each other? anything I can read up on?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @riddler18k there are asset chains which are independent blockchains along with the assets contract which are non-fungible tokens that can be created on the independent blockchains. You're likely referring to the asset chains. They can "talk to each other" via Momom protocol.(merkle root of merkle root of merkle root) Momom data is included with each notarization, so any notarized chain can verify that a transaction happened on any other notarized chain

Author: riddler18k#0791

Author: riddler18k#0791
Content: re swarm.. its file storage... say there is a file i want to store on decentralised storage.... how would I do it on KMD?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: https://github.com/StakedChain/PoS_scripts/tree/master/streamer

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's a rough PoC, but it works

Author: Alright#0419
Content: basically, spin up a permissioned chain, "stream" the file to it with that and have notaries notarize it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: You can do it on non-permissioned chains, but you'll be limited by block size and time

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @riddler18k if you're interested in playing around with that @blackjok3r is the man to talk to. He made it

Content: looking at https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/installations/creating-asset-chains.html#creating-a-new-asset-chain it doesn't show parameter for blocksize so am presuming it is preset for a new chain right? We could only change it we were to fork KMD rather than create an asset chain....

Author: Alright#0419
Content: It's 2mb on every asset chain right now. Changes to 4mb after December 15 hardfork

Author: riddler18k#0791
Content: aaah of course sapling üòÉ

Author: Alright#0419
Content: You should be able to create a new parameter to change blocksize then merge that into KMD

Author: Alright#0419
Content: or just set it manually and fork

Author: riddler18k#0791
Content: and in terms of transaction fee for a chain.... how/where is that set?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do you want to set a minimum?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's not consensus enforced, miners can choose what they will put into blocks

Author: riddler18k#0791
Content: and if it's POS?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: It's still set by miner

Author: Alright#0419
Content: or staker if that's what you want to call it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Do you want lower or higher fees than default?

Author: riddler18k#0791
Content: I was actually thinking of having a flat fee or being able to set that providing i can get all the miners to agree say every year or so

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Is allowing miners decide what they'll put into blocks not going to work with your chain?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: that's default behavior, comes from bitcoin

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so user can send a tx with no transaction fee, but it won't get confirmed until a miner who is allowing free transactions mines a block

Author: riddler18k#0791
Content: oh sorry misunderstood! yep of course standard behaviour, thinking about more on lines of having an asset to manage storage for my platform and how transaction costs would work
